translation: Description of the Construction of the Court-Building by Yudhishtar

gurmukhi: mY iek dYq huqo iqn Awie kY suMdr eyk sBw su bnweI ] l`jq hoie rhy Amrwvq AYsI pRBw ieh BUmih AweI ]
transliteration: Mai Ik Dait Houto Tin Aae Kai Soundar Ek Sabhaa Su Banaaee|| Lajjat Hoe Rahe Amraavat Aisiprabhaa Eh Bhoomah(i) Aaee||
translation: There was a demon named Mai; he, on reaching there constructed such a Court-Building, on seeing which the abode of gods felt shy;

gurmukhi: bYT ibrwjq BUp qhw jdubIr lIey sMg cwro eI BweI ] sXwm BnY iqh AwBih kI aupmw muK qy brnI nih jweI ]2359]
transliteration: Baith Biraajat Bhoop Tahaa Jadoubeer Leee San Chdaro Ibhaaee|| Syaam Bhanai Tih Aabhah(i) Kioupmaa Moukh Te Baraninah(i) Jaaee||2359||
translation: Yudhishtar was seated there alongwith his four brothers and Krihsna, the poet Shyam says that that elegance was indescribable.2359

gurmukhi: nIr Fry khUM cwdr C`qn CUtq hY khUM Taur Puhwry ] m`l iBry khUM m`q krI khUM nwcq bysXn kysu AKwry ]
transliteration: Neer Ddare Kahoon Chaadar Chhattan Chhodhtat Hai Kahoon Thaur Phuhdare|| Mall Bhite Kahoon Matt Karikahoon Naachat Besyan Kes(u) Akhdare||
translation: In the Court-construction, somewhere there were fountains of water on the roofs and somewhere the water was flowing; somewhere the wrestlers were fighting; and somewhere the intoxicated elephants were clashing among themselves; somewhere the female dancer

gurmukhi: bwj lrY khUM swj sjY Bt Cwjq hY Aiq fIl iflwry ] rwjq sRI biRjnwQ qhwN ijm qwrn mY sis sXwm aucwry ]2360]
transliteration: Baaj Darai Kahoon Saaj Sajai Bhat Chhaadat Hai At(i) Deel Dildare|| Raajat Sribrijnaath Tahaan Jim Taaran Mai Sas(i) Syaam Ouchdare||2360||
translation: Somewhere the horses were colliding and somewhere sturdy and shapely warriors looked splendid; Krishna was there like moon among the stars.2360.

gurmukhi: joiq lsY khUM b`jn kI khUM lwl lgy Cb mMdr pwvY ] nwgn ko prlok purI sur dyK pRBw ijh sIs invwvY ]
transliteration: Jot(i) Lasai Kahoon Bajjan Kikahoon Laal Lage Chhab Mandar Paavai||
translation: Somewhere the splendour of stones and somewhere of jewels was seen; seeing the elegance of precious stones, the abodes of gods bowed there heads;

gurmukhi: rIJ rhy ijh dyK cqurmuK hyr pRBw iSv so llcwvY ] BUm jhwN qhwN nIr so lwgq nIr jhwN nhI cInbo AwvY ]2361]
transliteration: Reejh Rahe Jih Dekh Chaturmoukh Her Prabhaa Shiv So Lalchaavai|| Bhoom Jahaan Neer So Laagad Neer Jahaan Nahicheenb Aavai||2361||
translation: Seeing the magnificence of that Court-Building, Brahma was getting pleased and Shiva was also allured in his mind; where there was earth, there was deception of water there; and somewhere there was water, it could not be ascertained.2361.
Speech of Yudhishtar addressed to Duryodhana:

gurmukhi: AYsI sBw ric kY su juiDStr AMD ko bwlku bol pTwXo ] sUrj ko suq sMg lIey Aru BIKm mwn BrXo soaU AwXo ]
transliteration: Aisisabhaa Rach(i) Kai Su Judhishtar Andh Ko Baalak(u) Bol Pathaayo|| Sooraj Ko Sout San Leee Ar(u) Bhikham Maan Bdaryo Sooo Aayo||
translation: After the construction of this Court-Building, Yudhistar invited Duryodhana; he reached there proudly alongwith Bhishma and Karan,

gurmukhi: BUm jhwN huqI qwih lKXo jl bwr huqo jh BUm jnwXo ] jwie inSMk prXo jl mY kib sXwm khY kCu Byd n pwXo ]2362]
transliteration: Bhoom Jahaan Houtitaah(i) Lakhyo Jal Baar Houto Jah Bhoom Janaayo|| Jaae Nishank Daryo Jal Mai Kabi Syaam Kahai Kachh(u) Bhed Na Paayo||2362||
translation: And he saw water, where there was earth and where there was water, he considered it as earth; in this way, without understanding the mystery, he fell into the water.2362.
